  "article_text": [
    "in 1954 , j. milnor @xcite introduced a concept of _ link - homotopy _ which is a weaker equivalence relation than link type , where link - homotopy is an equivalence relation generated by crossing changes on the same component . and",
    "he @xcite , @xcite defined _ milnor @xmath5-invariants _ which are given as follows .",
    "( see subsection [ milnor invariants ] for detail definitions . )",
    "let @xmath6 be an oriented ordered @xmath7-component link in @xmath8 .",
    "the _ milnor number @xmath9 _ is an integer determined by a finite sequence @xmath10 of numbers in @xmath11 .",
    "let @xmath12 be the greatest common devisor of @xmath13 s , where @xmath14 is obtained from proper subsequence of @xmath10 by permuting cyclicly .",
    "the milnor @xmath5-invariant @xmath15 is the residue class of @xmath9 modulo @xmath12 .",
    "the length of @xmath10 is called the _ length _ of @xmath15 and denoted by @xmath16 .",
    "milnor @xcite gave a link - homotopy classification for 2- or 3-component links by milnor @xmath5-invariants .",
    "in 1988 , j. p. levine @xcite gave a link - homotopy classification for 4-component links . in 1990 ,",
    "n. habegger and x. s. lin @xcite gave an algorithm which determines if two links with arbitrarily many components are link - homotopic .",
    "in @xcite , they defined milnor numbers for string links which are similarly defined as links and proved that milnor numbers are invariants for string links .",
    "moreover they showed that milnor numbers give a link - homotopy classification for string links with arbitrarily many components .",
    "we remark that milnor numbers are complete link - homotopy invariants for string links , but milnor @xmath5-invariants are not strong enough to classify for links up to link - homotopy .",
    "an embedded graph in the @xmath3-sphere @xmath8 is called a _",
    "spatial graph_. let @xmath17 be a graph consisting of @xmath7 loops , each loop connected to a vertex by an edge .",
    "we call a spatial graph of @xmath17 an _ @xmath7-clover link _ in @xmath8 @xcite . given an @xmath7-clover link @xmath18",
    ", we construct an @xmath7-component bottom tangle @xmath19 by using a _ disk / band surface _",
    "@xmath20 of @xmath18 . in @xcite ,",
    "levine defined the milnor number for a bottom tangle .",
    "therefore we define the _ milnor number @xmath21 for an @xmath7-clover link @xmath18 _ to be the milnor number @xmath22 . in @xcite , a bottom tangle",
    "is called a string link .",
    "( the name bottom tangle  follows k. habiro @xcite . ) in this paper , we mean that a string link is one defined in @xcite .",
    "there is a one - to - one correspondence between the sets of string links and bottom tangles .",
    "( see subsection  [ tangles ] . )",
    "this correspondence naturally induces the one - to - one correspondence between the milnor number for the bottom tangles and the milnor number for the string links .",
    "we remark that there are infinitely many choices of @xmath23 for @xmath18 , and hence that , in general , @xmath24 is not an invariant for @xmath18 .",
    "but under a certain condition , @xmath24 is well - defined as follows .",
    "let @xmath18 be an @xmath7-clover link and @xmath25 a link which is the disjoint union of loops of @xmath18 .",
    "if @xmath26 for any sequence @xmath14 with @xmath27 , then @xmath28 is well - defined for any sequence @xmath10 with @xmath29 .    in 1988",
    ", levine @xcite already defined milnor numbers for _ flat vertex _",
    "clover links and proved the same result as the theorem above , where a flat vertex spatial graph is a spatial graph @xmath30 , for each vertex @xmath31 of @xmath30 , there exist a neighborhood @xmath32 of @xmath31 and a small flat plane @xmath33 such that @xmath34 @xcite . in this paper",
    ", we do not assume that clover links are flat vertex ones .",
    "and we consider that two clover links are _ equivalent _ if they are ambient isotopic .    by using milnor numbers for clover links",
    ", we have the following results for an edge - homotopy classification of clover links , where edge - homotopy is an equivalence relation generated by crossing changes on the same spatial edge .",
    "this equivalence relation was introduced by k. taniyama @xcite as a generalization of link - homotopy .",
    "let @xmath35 be two @xmath7-clover links and @xmath36 links which are disjoint unions of loops of @xmath35 respectively .",
    "suppose that @xmath37 for any sequence @xmath14 with @xmath38 . then @xmath18 and @xmath39 are ( edge - homotopy@xmath40)-equivalence if and only if @xmath41 for any non - repeated sequence @xmath10 with @xmath42 , where ( edge - homotopy@xmath40)-equivalence is an equivalence relation obtained by combining edge - homotopy and @xmath2-equivalence which is defined by habiro @xcite .",
    "we also have the following proposition .",
    "let @xmath35 be two @xmath7-clover links and @xmath36 links which are disjoint unions of loops of @xmath35 respectively .",
    "suppose that @xmath37 for any sequence @xmath14 with @xmath43 . then @xmath18 and @xmath39 are edge - homotopic if and only if @xmath41 for any non - repeated sequence @xmath10 with @xmath44 .",
    "it is the definition that the milnor @xmath5-invariant of length @xmath45 is zero . if @xmath46 , then the proposition above holds without the condition .",
    "two 3-clover links @xmath18 and @xmath39 are edge - homotopic if and only if @xmath47 for any non - repeated sequence @xmath10 with @xmath48 .",
    "let @xmath18 be a clover link and @xmath49 a link which is the disjoint union of loops of @xmath18 . by the definition of @xmath24 in subsection [ milnor invariants",
    "] , we note that @xmath50 for any non - repeated sequence @xmath10 if and only if @xmath51 for @xmath10 . and",
    "we also note that all milnor numbers for a trivial clover link vanish , where a clover link is _ trivial _ if there is an embedded plane in @xmath52 which contains the clover link .",
    "it is shown by milnor  @xcite that a link is link - homotopic to a trivial link if and only if the milnor @xmath5-invariant vanishes for any non - repeated sequence .",
    "hence , by the proposition above , we have that @xmath18 is edge - homotopic to a trivial clover link if and only if @xmath25 is link - homotopic to a trivial link .",
    "i would like to express my best gratitude to professor akira yasuhara for his helpful advice and continuous encouragement .",
    "i also would like to thank professor kokoro tanaka for his useful comments .",
    "in this section we will define milnor numbers for clover links .",
    "an @xmath7-component _ tangle _ is a properly embedded disjoint union of @xmath7 arcs in the @xmath3-cube @xmath53^{3}$ ] .",

    "note that any disk / band surface of a spatial graph is ambient isotopic to a surface constructed by putting a disk at each vertex of the spatial graph , connecting the disks with bands along the spatial edges .",
    "we remark that for a spatial graph , there are infinitely many disk / band surfaces up to ambient isotopy",

    "[ well - definedness ] let @xmath18 be an @xmath7-clover link and @xmath25 a link which is the disjoint union of leaves of @xmath18 . if @xmath26 for any sequence @xmath14 with @xmath27 , then @xmath28 is well - defined for any sequence @xmath10 with @xmath29 .",
    "levine @xcite proved the same result as theorem [ well - definedness ] for _ flat vertex _",
    "clover links under _",
    "flatly isotopy_. see subsection [ sectionwell - definedness ] for the definition of a flatly isotopy .      in order to prove theorem [ well - definedness ] , we need two lemmas [ lemma1 ] and [ lemma2 ] .",
    "two flat vertex graphs @xmath30 and @xmath176 are _ flatly isotopic _ if there exists an isotopy @xmath177)$ ] such that @xmath178 , @xmath179 and @xmath180 is a flat vertex graph for each @xmath69 $ ] .",
    "we call such a isotopy @xmath181 a _ flatly isotopy _ @xcite .    an @xmath7-component _ braid _",
    "@xmath182 is a tangle in @xmath53^{3}$ ] such that for each @xmath183 , @xmath184 intersects @xmath53\\times[0,1]\\times \\{t\\}$ ] transversely at @xmath7 points . in particular",
    ", @xmath185 is a _ pure braid _ if for any @xmath55 , the boundary @xmath186^{3}$ ] for @xmath187 $ ] .",
    "[ lemma1 ] if two @xmath7-clover links @xmath18 and @xmath39 are ambient isotopic to each other , then there exists an @xmath7-clover link @xmath188 such that @xmath188 is obtained from @xmath18 by a single b - move and @xmath188 is flatly isotopic to @xmath39 , where a b - move is a local move as illustrated in figure  [ b - move ] .",
    "fig9.eps ( 130,77)b - move ( 223,75)braid    consider regular diagrams @xmath189 of @xmath35 respectively . since @xmath18 and @xmath39 are ambient isotopic to each other , @xmath190 and @xmath191 are related by a finite sequence of reidemeister moves ( i ) @xmath192 ( v ) as illustrated in figure  [ reidemeister - moves ] @xcite .",
    "fig10.eps ( -20,330)(i ) ( -20,260)(ii ) ( -20,178)(iii ) ( -20,100)(iv ) ( -20,22)(v )    moves excepting move ( iv ) are realized by flatly isotopies .",
    "move ( iv ) consists of two kinds transformations .",
    "one increases a crossing , and the other decreases a crossing .",
    "we call those two kinds of transformations move ( iv)@xmath193 and move ( iv)@xmath194 respectively .",
    "it is not hard to see that a move ( iv)@xmath194 is realized by moves ( iv)@xmath193 and ( ii ) .",
    "hence moves ( i ) @xmath192 ( v ) are realized by moves ( i ) @xmath192 ( iii ) , ( v ) and ( iv)@xmath193 .",
    "we consider a move ( iv)@xmath193 .",
    "if we apply a move ( iv)@xmath193 to a regular diagram @xmath195 of an @xmath7-clover link , then we obtain a regular diagram either ( a ) or ( b ) as illustrated in figure  [ applying - move(iv ) ] . the diagram ( a ) is clearly obtained from @xmath195 by a single @xmath196-move , where @xmath196-move is a local move of regular diagrams which correspond to b - move .",
    "the diagram ( b ) is transformed into a diagram ( b@xmath197 ) as illustrated in figure  [ about(b ) ] by a finite sequence of moves ( i)@xmath192(iii ) and ( v ) .",
    "so the diagram ( b ) is obtained from @xmath195 by moves ( i)@xmath192(iii ) , ( v ) and a @xmath196-moves .",
    "thus a move ( iv)@xmath193 is realized by moves ( i)@xmath192(iii ) , ( v ) and a @xmath196-move .",
    "it follows that moves ( i ) @xmath192 ( v ) are realized by moves ( i ) @xmath192 ( iii ) , ( v ) and @xmath196-moves .",
    "fig11.eps ( 83,44)(iv)@xmath193 ( 200,37)or ( 28,-12)@xmath195 ( 147,-10)(a ) ( 246,-10)(b ) ( -12,57)@xmath115 ( 10,77)@xmath111 ( 52,77)@xmath198 ( 69,57)@xmath117 ( 108,57)@xmath115 ( 125,77)@xmath198 ( 169,77)@xmath111 ( 190,57)@xmath117 ( 208,62)@xmath115 ( 229,77)@xmath111 ( 265,77)@xmath198 ( 283,62)@xmath117    fig12.eps ( 83,47)(i)s@xmath192(iii ) s ( 90,32)and ( v ) s ( 36,-10)(b ) ( 166,-10)(b@xmath197 ) ( -3,68)@xmath115 ( 19,84)@xmath111 ( 52,84)@xmath198 ( 73,68)@xmath117 ( 126,62)@xmath115 ( 151,84)@xmath111 ( 187,84)@xmath198 ( 212,62)@xmath117    applying a move ( v ) , subsequently a @xmath196-move can be realized by applying a @xmath196-move , subsequently a move ( v ) and several moves ( ii ) and ( iii ) , see figure  [ commutative ] . it is clear that applying each move ( @xmath70 )  ( @xmath199 i , ii , iii ) , subsequently a @xmath196-move can be realized by applying @xmath196-moves , subsequently a move ( @xmath70 ) .",

    "s    so applying several moves ( i)@xmath192(iii ) and ( v ) , subsequently a @xmath196-move can be realized by applying a @xmath196-move , subsequently several moves ( i)@xmath192(iii ) and ( v ) .",
    "therefore there exists a regular diagram @xmath200 of an @xmath7-clover link @xmath188 such that @xmath200 is obtained from @xmath190 by a finite sequence of @xmath196-moves and @xmath191 is obtained from @xmath200 by a finite sequence of moves ( i)@xmath192(iii ) and ( v ) .",
    "we note that a finite sequence of @xmath196-moves is realized by a single @xmath196-move .",
    "this completes the proof .",

    "we directly prove by calculus of milnor numbers .",
    "@xcite [ lemma2 ] let @xmath138 be an @xmath7-component bottom tangle and @xmath218 a bottom tangle obtained from @xmath138 by a sl - move .",
    "if @xmath219 for any sequence @xmath14 with @xmath27 , then @xmath220 for any sequence @xmath10 with @xmath29 .",

    "let @xmath249 $ ] as illustrated in figure  [ bandbottomtangle ] . by the assumption ,",
    "milnor numbers for @xmath138 and @xmath218 of length @xmath0 vanish , so @xmath250 and @xmath251 can be written respectively in the form @xmath252 where @xmath253 and @xmath254 mean the terms of degree @xmath255 .",
    "first , we observe @xmath256 .",

    "let us briefly recall from @xcite the basic notations of clasper theory . in this paper , we essentially only need the notation of @xmath294-tree .",
    "for a general definition of claspers , we refer the reader to @xcite .",
    "let @xmath6 be a ( clover ) link in @xmath8 ( resp . a tangle in @xmath53^{3}$ ] ) .",
    "an embedded disk @xmath295 in @xmath8 ( resp .",
    "@xmath53^{3}$ ] ) is called a _ tree clasper _ for @xmath6 if it satisfies the following ( 1 ) , ( 2 ) and ( 3 ) : + ( 1 ) @xmath295 is decomposed into disks and bands , called _ edges _ , each of which connects two distinct disks .",
    "+ ( 2 ) the disks have either 1 or 3 incident edges , called _ disk - leaves _ or _ nodes _ respectively .",
    "+ ( 3 ) @xmath6 intersects @xmath295 transversely and the intersections are contained in the union of the interior of the disk - leaves .",
    "+ the _ degree _ of a tree clasper is the number of the disk - leaves minus 1 .",
    "( in @xcite , a tree clasper is called a _ strict tree clasper_. ) a degree @xmath296 tree clasper is called a _ @xmath294-tree_. a @xmath294-tree is _ simple _ if each disk - leaf intersects @xmath6 at one point",
    ".    we will make use of the drawing convention for claspers of ( * ? ? ?",
    "4 ) . given a @xmath294-tree @xmath295 for @xmath6 , there is a procedure to construct a framed link @xmath297 in a regular neighborhood of @xmath295 . _",
    "surgery along @xmath295 _ means surgery along @xmath297 .",
    "since surgery along @xmath297 preserves the ambient space , surgery along the @xmath294-tree @xmath295 can be regarded as a local move on @xmath6 in @xmath8 ( resp .",
    "@xmath53^{3}$ ] ) .",
    "we say that the _ resulting one @xmath298 in @xmath8 ( resp .",
    "@xmath53^{3}$ ] ) is obtained from @xmath6 by surgery along @xmath295_. similarly , for a disjoint union of trees @xmath299 , we can define @xmath300 .",
    "two ( string ) links ( resp . a clover link ) are _ @xmath301-equivalence _ if they are transformed into each other by surgery along @xmath301-trees .",
    "the relation between @xmath301-equivalence and milnor invariants is known as follows .",
    "* theorem 7.2 ) [ thmh ] milnor invariants of length @xmath0 for ( string ) links are invariants of @xmath294-equivalence .    a @xmath294-tree @xmath295 for a ( string ) link ( resp .",
    "a clover link ) @xmath6 is a _ self @xmath301-tree _ if all disk - leaves of @xmath295 intersect the same component ( resp . the same spatial edge ) of @xmath6 .",
    "the _ self @xmath301-equivalence _ is an equivalence relation generated by surgery along self @xmath301-trees .",
    "we remark that self @xmath302-equivalence for a ( string ) link ( resp .",
    "a clover link ) is the same relation as link - homotopy ( resp .",
    "edge - homotopy ) .      the ( edge - homotopy+@xmath301)-equivalence is an equivalence relation obtained by combining edge - homotopy and @xmath301-equivalence .",
    "[ mainthm ] let @xmath35 be two @xmath7-clover links and @xmath36 links which are disjoint unions of leaves of @xmath35 respectively .",
    "suppose that @xmath37 for any sequence @xmath14 with @xmath38 . then @xmath18 and @xmath39 are ( edge - homotopy@xmath40)-equivalence if and only if @xmath41 for any non - repeated sequence @xmath10 with @xmath42 .",
    "let @xmath18 be a clover link and @xmath25 a link which is the disjoint union of leaves of @xmath18 .",
    "since the union of stems of @xmath18 and the root is contractible , we may assume that a @xmath301-tree @xmath295 for @xmath18 satisfies @xmath303 . by the zip construction  @xcite for @xmath295 , @xmath295 becomes a disjoint union of simple @xmath301-trees for @xmath25 .",

    "in order to prove theorem  [ mainthm ] , we need the following lemma and a theorem given by @xcite .",
    "[ lemma3 ] let @xmath35 be two clover links . then @xmath18 and @xmath39 are ( edge - homotopy@xmath310)-equivalence if and only if there exist disk / band surfaces @xmath311 of @xmath35 respectively such that the bottom tangles @xmath23 and @xmath312 are ( link - homotopy@xmath310)-equivalence .",
    "we first prove the sufficient condition . by the assumption",
    ", there exists a disjoint union @xmath128 of self @xmath313-trees and @xmath294-trees for @xmath18 such that @xmath314 . for @xmath35 ,",
    "let @xmath311 be disk / band surfaces of @xmath35 respectively .",
    "we may assume that @xmath315 is contained in the interior of @xmath128 .",
    "then we have @xmath316 if necessary adding full - twists to bands of @xmath317 .",
    "therefore @xmath318 and @xmath128 consists of self @xmath302-trees and @xmath301-trees for @xmath19 .",
    "we next prove the necessary condition .",
    "let @xmath319 be the union of stems and the root of @xmath18 , and let @xmath320 be the regular neighborhood of @xmath319 .",
    "then we may assume that @xmath319 is equal to the union of stems and the root of @xmath39 and @xmath321 .",
    "similarly @xmath322 . by the assumption , @xmath23 and @xmath312 are ( link - homotopy@xmath310)-equivalence .",
    "this completes the proof .",

    "let us prove the necessary condition .",
    "let @xmath341 be disk / band surfaces of @xmath35 respectively and let be the @xmath342 be @xmath7-component bottom tangles . by theorem [ thmy ] , two string links which correspond to @xmath19 and @xmath312 are link - homotopic to @xmath343 and @xmath344 respectively .",
    "both @xmath345 and @xmath346 are @xmath347-equivalent to an @xmath7-component trivial string link .",
    "set @xmath348 , by theorem  [ thmy ] , the two string links which correspond to @xmath19 and @xmath312 are ( link - homotopy+@xmath2 ) to @xmath349 and @xmath350 respectively .",
    "we recall that if @xmath351 , @xmath2-equivalence implies link - homotopy . by the assumption , since @xmath352 for any non - repeated sequence @xmath10 with @xmath29 , we have @xmath353 for each @xmath354 .",
    "this implies @xmath23 and @xmath312 are ( link - homotopy@xmath40)-equivalence .",
    "lemma [ lemma3 ] completes the proof .",
    "j. milnor , _ isotopy of links . algebraic geometry and topology",
    "_ , a symposium in honor of s. lefschetz , pp . 280306 .",
    "princeton university press , princeton , n. j. , ( 1957 ) .",
    "j. stallings , _ homology and central series of groups _ , j. algebra 2 ( 1965 ) , 170181 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> given a clover link , we construct a bottom tangle by using a disk / band surface of the clover link . </S>",
    "<S> since the milnor number is already defined for a bottom tangle , we define the milnor number for the clover link to be the milnor number for the bottom tangle and show that for a clover link , if milnor numbers of length @xmath0 vanish , then milnor numbers of length @xmath1 are well - defined . </S>",
    "<S> moreover we prove that two clover links whose milnor numbers of length @xmath0 vanish are equivalent up to edge - homotopy and @xmath2-equivalence if and only if those milnor numbers of length @xmath1 are equal . </S>",
    "<S> in particular , we give an edge - homotopy classification of @xmath3-clover links by their milnor numbers of length @xmath4 . </S>"
  ]
}
